## Create ML Evaluation Dashboards

```python
from dashboard_lego.presets.ml_presets import (
    ConfusionMatrixPreset,
    FeatureImportancePreset,
    RocAucCurvePreset,
    ModelSummaryBlock
)
from dashboard_lego.core import DataSource, DashboardPage
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.datasets import make_classification
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
import pandas as pd
import dash_bootstrap_components as dbc

# Prepare data and train model
X, y = make_classification(n_samples=1000, n_features=10, random_state=42)
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.3)

model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)
y_proba = model.predict_proba(X_test)

# Create ML evaluation datasources
cm_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'y_true': y_test,
    'y_pred': y_pred
})

feature_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'feature': [f'feature_{i}' for i in range(10)],
    'importance': model.feature_importances_
})

roc_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'y_true': y_test,
    'y_score': y_proba[:, 1]
})

# Confusion Matrix
cm_block = ConfusionMatrixPreset(
    block_id="confusion",
    datasource=DataSource(build_fn=lambda p: cm_df),
    title="Model Confusion Matrix"
)

# Feature Importance
fi_block = FeatureImportancePreset(
    block_id="importance",
    datasource=DataSource(build_fn=lambda p: feature_df),
    title="Feature Importance"
)

# ROC Curve
roc_block = RocAucCurvePreset(
    block_id="roc",
    datasource=DataSource(build_fn=lambda p: roc_df),
    title="ROC-AUC Curve"
)

# Model Summary
model_summary = ModelSummaryBlock(
    block_id="summary",
    datasource=DataSource(),
    model_info={
        "Algorithm": "Random Forest",
        "n_estimators": 100,
        "max_depth": "None",
        "Accuracy": f"{(y_pred == y_test).mean():.2%}"
    },
    title="Model Configuration"
)

# Assemble ML dashboard
ml_page = DashboardPage(
    title="ML Model Evaluation",
    blocks=[
        [model_summary],
        [(cm_block, {"md": 6}), (fi_block, {"md": 6})],
        [roc_block]
    ],
    theme=dbc.themes.DARKLY
)
```

## State Management Example: Publishing and Subscribing to Filters

```python
from dashboard_lego.blocks import TypedChartBlock, get_metric_row, Control
import dash_core_components as dcc

# Block A publishes filter state
interactive_chart = TypedChartBlock(
    block_id="filter_chart",
    datasource=datasource,
    plot_type="bar",
    plot_params={"x": "{{category}}", "y": "Sales"},
    controls={"category": Control(component=dcc.Dropdown, props={"options": [...]}})
)

# Block B subscribes to filter state
metrics, row_opts = get_metric_row(
    metrics_spec={
        "total_sales": {
            "column": "Sales",
            "agg": "sum",
            "title": "Total Sales",
            "color": "success"
        }
    },
    datasource=datasource,
    subscribes_to="filter_chart-category"  # Subscribes to category filter
)
```

## Multi-State Subscriptions in Python

```python
# Multiple publishers
date_filter = ControlPanelBlock(
    block_id="date_filter",
    datasource=datasource,
    title="Date Range",
    controls={"date_range": Control(...)}
)

category_filter = ControlPanelBlock(
    block_id="category_filter",
    datasource=datasource,
    title="Category",
    controls={"category": Control(...)}
)

# Subscriber to multiple states
chart = TypedChartBlock(
    block_id="multi_chart",
    datasource=datasource,
    title="Filtered Analysis",
    plot_type='bar',
    plot_params={'x': 'Product', 'y': 'Sales'},
    subscribes_to=[
        "date_filter-date_range",
        "category_filter-category"
    ]
)
```

## DataSource with Lambda Functions - Basic Usage

```python
# Simple datasource with lambda functions
datasource = DataSource(
    build_fn=lambda params: pd.read_csv(params.get('file', 'default.csv')),
    transform_fn=lambda df: df.groupby('category').sum().reset_index()
)
```

## DataSource - Stateless Data Pipeline with Lambda Functions

```python
import pandas as pd
from dashboard_lego.core import DataSource, DataBuilder, DataTransformer

# Pattern 1: Lambda-based (simplest - no classes needed)
datasource = DataSource(
    build_fn=lambda params: pd.read_csv("sales.csv"),
    transform_fn=lambda df: df[df['Revenue'] > 1000]
)
```
